content: Welcome to CS188, Fall 2014!
Homework 1 is due on Monday, 2/3, at 11:59pm.

Project 1 has been released. It is due Friday, 2/7 at 5pm. Here is a PDF file of the project specifications. Please keep in mind that this project is a bit lengthy, so please get started early!

After you have finished the project, you also have the opportunity of participating in a Pacman Capture the Flag Contest where you can compete against your classmates and the staff bots and earn extra credit. Instructions are provided in the general contest guidelines and the P1 contest guidelines pages. Note that slip days cannot be used for the contest. The contest site will close to new submissions promptly at Friday, 2/7 at 5pm. At this point, we will continue to run matches until the rankings converge.

Happy searching!
Homework 2 is due on Monday, 2/10 at 11:59pm.
Homework 3 is due on Tuesday, 2/18 at 11:59pm.

Project 2 has been released. It is due on Friday, 2/21, at 5:00pm. Here is a PDF file of the project specifications.

Contest 2 has also been released. It is optional and due on Sunday, 2/23, at 11:59pm.

Happy adversarial searching! Let the games begin!
Homework 4 is due on Monday, 2/24 at 11:59pm.
Homework 5 is due on Monday, 3/3 at 11:59pm.

Project 3 has been released. It is due on Friday, 3/7, at 5:00pm. Here is a PDF file of the project specifications. Please start early on this project and plan your time wisely, since the due date is very close to the first midterm.

Contest 3 has also been released. It is optional and due on Thursday, 3/13, at 11:59pm.

Have fun making your agents learn!

Midterm 1 is approaching!

Midterm 1 will be held on Monday, March 10th, 6:30-9:30pm, in three rooms:

  • 120 Latimer [Last names beginning with A-F]
  • 1 Pimentel [Last names beginning with G-S]
  • 145 Dwinelle [Last names beginning with T-Z]

We have posted an optional practice midterm, and we will give you one point of extra credit on the midterm for submitting your work. To receive the extra credit, you must submit your practice midterm by March 8th, at 11:59pm. You can find the practice midterm on the Midterm Preparation Page, along with the details of the exam and office hours for this week.

Also, please check out Piazza post for more information regarding logistics for the midterm exam week.
Solutions to the Practice Midterm 1 exam are released.
Homework 6 is due on Monday, 3/17 at 11:59pm.

Project 4 has been released. It is due on Friday, 3/21, at 5pm.

Happy ghostbusting!
Homework 7 is due on Tuesday, 4/1 at 11:59pm.

The mini contest result slides have been uploaded and can be found here:
Mini-Contest 1
Mini-Contest 2
Mini-Contest 3
Congratulations again to everyone whose bots did great!

The Final Contest has been released. It is optional and closes on Sunday, 4/27, at 11:59pm.

There are also opportunities to earn extra credit every Sunday at 11:59pm, starting on 3/30, up until the contest closes.
Homework 8 is due on Tuesday, 4/8 at 11:59pm.
Homework 9 is due on Monday, 4/14 at 11:59pm.

Midterm 2 is approaching!

Midterm 2 will be held on Monday, April 21st, 6:30-9:30pm, in three rooms:

  • 120 Latimer [Last names beginning with A-F]
  • 1 Pimentel [Last names beginning with G-S]
  • 145 Dwinelle [Last names beginning with T-Z]

We have posted an optional practice midterm, and we will give you one point of extra credit on the midterm for submitting your work. To receive the extra credit, you must submit your practice midterm by April 19th, at 11:59pm. You can find the practice midterm on the Midterm Preparation Page, along with the details of the exam and office hours for this week.
Solutions to the practice midterm 2 exam are released.
Homework 10 is due on Monday, 4/28 at 11:59pm.
Project 5 has been released. It is due Friday, May 9th, at 5:00pm.

The final exam is approaching!

The final will be held on Thursday, May 15th, 3:00-6:00pm, at 100 Haas Pavilion .

We have posted an optional practice final, and we will give you one point of extra credit on the final for submitting your work. To receive the extra credit, you must submit your practice final by Saturday, May 10th, at 11:59pm. You can find the practice final on the Final Exam Preparation Page, along with the details of the exam and office hours for RRR week and finals week.

Welcome to the archived materials from the Fall 2013 CS188 Artificial Intelligence on-campus offering at UC Berkeley. These materials are made available for anyone for self-study, but there will be no active support from the teaching staff for these materials. We do hope to offer this course with active support again in the future. Instructors in particular might also want to check out ai.berkeley.edu, where we host all of our materials for instructors.
